BaH.Persistence: Types Modinfo Source  

Persistence

An object-persistence framework.

Persistence is a means of storing data beyond the execution of a program, in such a way that the data can be reproduced, in memory, at a later time.

The BaH.Persistence module attempts to do this through the use of reflection and xml.

Usage

The most simple usage is to pass an object into TPersist.Serialize(), which returns the serialized representation of it as a String.

To reverse the process, the serialized String can be passed into TPersist.DeSerialize(), returning a new Object instance, which is essentially a "deep" copy of the original object.

There are also methods, SerializeToFile(), SerializeToDoc(), and SerializeToStream() which output to different formats apporpriately.

The DeSerialize() function itself can take a TxmlDoc, TStream or String data as a parameter, as well as there being the specialised methods of DeSerializeFromDoc(), DeSerializeFromFile(), and DeSerializeFromStream().

TPersist Object Persistence.

Const BMO_VERSION:Int
DescriptionFile format version.
Global compressed:Int
DescriptionCompressed serialization.
InformationSet to True to compress the serialized data. Default is False - no compression.
Global format:Int
DescriptionSerialized formatting.
InformationSet to True to have the data formatted nicely. Default is False - off.
Global maxDepth:Int
DescriptionNode-depth of XML to support when de-serializing.
InformationDefault is 1024.

If you have any problems with this, make it bigger.

DescriptionDe-serializes doc into an Object structure.
InformationIt is up to the user to free the supplied TxmlDoc.
